unnormalised: ## Ditching the Chai for Cannes: Why Film Festivals are Totally Worth It
normalised: ## ditching the chai for Cannes: why film festivals are totally worth it

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Been meaning to spill the chai about something super cool: film festivals! Yeah, I know, sounds a bit artsy-fartsy, but trust me, it’s way more exciting than you think. Think of it as the ultimate movie binge, but with added glamour, networking, and the chance to discover the next big thing before everyone else.
normalised: hey everyone! been meaning to spill the chai about something super cool: film festivals! yeah, i know, sounds a bit artsy-fartsy, but trust me, it’s way more exciting than you think. think of it as the ultimate movie binge, but with added glamour, networking, and the chance to discover the next big thing before everyone else.

unnormalised: So, why should you, a perfectly sane person who enjoys binge-watching Bollywood masala flicks, consider attending a film festival? Well, first off, it's a cinematic smorgasbord! Forget your usual cinema fare. At festivals like the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa, you're exposed to films from across the globe. We're talking Iranian dramas that'll make you weep, quirky French comedies that'll have you snorting with laughter, and experimental Indian shorts that push boundaries like never before. Think Anurag Kashyap, but even wilder.

unnormalised: Secondly, the atmosphere is electric. It's a hub for filmmakers, actors, critics, and just plain movie buffs. You can bump into someone who worked on "3 Idiots" in the coffee queue, attend a Q&A with a director from Kazakhstan, or just chat with fellow cinephiles about the nuances of independent cinema over some delicious Goan seafood.

unnormalised: And let’s be real, the bragging rights are pretty sweet too. Imagine being able to say, “Oh yeah, I saw that film before it even got nominated for an Oscar at the Mumbai Film Festival, last year!” Instant cool points, guaranteed.

unnormalised: Of course, it's not all champagne and red carpets. Sometimes you're crammed into a tiny screening room at 10 AM, battling jet lag after your 1800 km train journey. And yeah, some films are... let's just say, not for everyone. But that’s part of the adventure!
normalised: of course, it's not all champagne and red carpets. sometimes you're crammed into a tiny screening room at ten A M, battling jet lag after your one thousand, eight hundred kilometer train journey. and yeah, some films are... let's just say, not for everyone. but that’s part of the adventure!

unnormalised: The next time a film festival pops up in your city – maybe even the Jaipur International Film Festival, give it a shot! You might just discover your new favourite director, a whole new genre, or at the very least, a newfound appreciation for the art of storytelling. Plus, think of all the insta-worthy pictures you can take!
